AccessorFunc.description:
[Shared/Menu] Adds simple Get/Set accessor functions on the specified table.
Can also force the value to be set to a number, bool or string.

[table] tab
  The table to add the accessor functions too.

[any] key
  The key of the table to be get/set.

[string] name
  The name of the functions (will be prefixed with Get and Set).

[number] force=nil
  The type the setter should force to (uses FORCE_ Enums).

AddCSLuaFile.description:
[Shared] Marks a Lua file to be sent to clients when they join the server. Doesn't do anything on the client - this means you can use it in a shared file without problems.

[string] file=currentfile
  The name/path to the Lua file that should be sent, relative to the garrysmod/lua folder. If no parameter is specified, it sends the current file.

The file path can be relative to the script it is ran from. For example, if your script is in lua/myfolder/stuff.lua, calling AddCSLuaFile("otherstuff.lua") and AddCSLuaFile("myfolder/otherstuff.lua") is the same thing.

AddConsoleCommand.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] name
  The name of the console command to add.

[string] helpText
  The help text.

[number] flags
  Concommand flags using FCVAR_ Enums

AddOriginToPVS.description:
[Server] Adds the specified vector to the PVS which is currently building. This allows all objects in visleafs visible from that vector to be drawn.

[Vector] position
  The origin to add.

AddWorldTip.description:
[Client] This function creates a World Tip, similar to the one shown when aiming at a Thruster where it shows you its force. This function will make a World Tip that will only last 50 milliseconds (1/20th of a second), so you must call it continuously as long as you want the World Tip to be shown. It is common to call it inside a Think hook. Contrary to what the function's name implies, it is impossible to create more than one World Tip at the same time. A new World Tip will overwrite the old one, so only use this function when you know nothing else will also be using it.
See SANDBOX:PaintWorldTips for more information.

[number] entindex=nil
  This argument is no longer used; it has no effect on anything. You can use nil in this argument.

[string] text
  The text for the world tip to display.

[number] dieTime=SysTime()+0.05
  This argument is no longer used; when you add a World Tip it will always last only 0.05 seconds. You can use nil in this argument.

[Vector] pos=ent:GetPos()
  Where in the world you want the World Tip to be drawn. If you add a valid Entity in the next argument, this argument will have no effect on the actual World Tip.

[Entity] ent=nil
  Which entity you want to associate with the World Tip. This argument is optional. If set to a valid entity, this will override the position set in pos with the Entity's position.

Add_NPC_Class.description:
[Shared/Menu] Defines a global entity class variable with an automatic value in order to prevent collisions with other CLASS_ Enums. You should prefix your variable with CLASS_ for consistency.

[string] name
  The name of the new enum/global variable.

AddonMaterial.description:
[Client/Menu] 

[string] name
  The name of the file.

Angle.description:
[Shared/Menu] Creates an Angle object.

[number] pitch=0
  The pitch value of the angle.
If this is an Angle, this function will return a copy of the given angle.
If this is a string, this function will try to parse the string as a angle. If it fails, it returns a 0 angle.

(See examples)

[number] yaw=0
  The yaw value of the angle.

[number] roll=0
  The roll value of the angle.

AngleRand.description: [Shared/Menu] Returns an angle with a randomized pitch, yaw and roll, first one between -90 and 90, the rest between -180 and 180 degrees.

BroadcastLua.description:
[Server] Sends the specified Lua code to all connected clients and executes it.

[string] code
  The code to be executed. Capped at length of 254 characters.

ChangeTooltip.description:
[Client/Menu] 

[Panel] panel
  Panel that has been hovered over

ClientsideModel.description:
[Client] Creates a non physical entity that only exists on the client.

[string] model
  The file path to the model.

[number] renderGroup=RENDERGROUP_OTHER
  The rendergroup of the entity, see RENDERGROUP_ Enums.

ClientsideRagdoll.description:
[Client] Creates a fully clientside ragdoll.

[string] model
  The file path to the model.

[number] renderGroup=RENDER_GROUP_OPAQUE
  The RENDERGROUP_ Enums to assign.

ClientsideScene.description:
[Client] Creates a scene entity based on the scene name and the entity.

[string] name
  The name of the scene.

[Entity] targetEnt
  The entity to play the scene on.

Color.description:
[Shared/Menu] Creates a Color structure.

[number] r
  An integer from 0-255 describing the red value of the color.

[number] g
  An integer from 0-255 describing the green value of the color.

[number] b
  An integer from 0-255 describing the blue value of the color.

[number] a=255
  An integer from 0-255 describing the alpha (transparency) of the color.

ColorAlpha.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns a new Color structure with the RGB components of the given Color structure and the alpha value specified.

[table] color
  The Color structure from which to take RGB values. This color will not be modified.

[number] alpha
  The new alpha value, a number between 0 and 255. Values above 255 will be clamped.

ColorToHSV.description:
[Shared/Menu] Converts a Color structure into HSV color space.

[table] color
  The Color structure.

CompileFile.description:
[Shared] Attempts to compile the given file. If successful, returns a function that can be called to perform the actual execution of the script.

[string] path
  Path to the file, relative to the garrysmod/lua/ directory.

CompileString.description:
[Shared/Menu] This function will compile the code argument as lua code and return a function that will execute that code. Please note that this function will not automatically execute the given code after compiling it.

[string] code
  The code to compile.

[string] identifier
  An identifier in case an error is thrown. (The same identifier can be used multiple times)

[boolean] HandleError=true
  If false this function will return an error string instead of throwing an error.

ConsoleAutoComplete.description:
[Menu] 

[string] text
  Text that the console commands must begin with.

CreateClientConVar.description:
[Shared/Menu] Makes a clientside-only console variable

[string] name
  Name of the ConVar to be created and able to be accessed.

This cannot be a name of existing console command or console variable. It will silently fail if it is.

[string] default
  Default value of the ConVar.

[boolean] shouldsave=true
  Should the ConVar be saved across sessions

[boolean] userdata=false
  Should the ConVar and its containing data be sent to the server when it has changed. This make the convar accessible from server using Player:GetInfoNum and similar functions.

[string] helptext=""
  Help text to display in the console.

CreateConVar.description:
[Shared/Menu] Creates a console variable (ConVar), in general these are for things like gamemode/server settings.

[string] name
  Name of the convar.

This cannot be a name of an engine console command or console variable. It will silently fail if it is. If it is the same name as another lua ConVar, it will return that ConVar object.

[string] value
  Default value of the convar.

[number] flags
  Flags of the convar, see FCVAR_ Enums, either as bitflag or as table.

[string] helptext
  The help text to show in the console.

CreateMaterial.description:
[Client/Menu] Creates a new material with the specified name and shader.

[string] name
  The material name. Must be unique.

[string] shaderName
  The shader name. See Category: Shaders.

[table] materialData
  Key-value table that contains shader parameters and proxies.

See: List of Shader Parameters on Valve Developers Wiki and each shader's page from Category: Shaders.

CreateParticleSystem.description:
[Client] Creates a new particle system

[Entity] ent
  The entity to attach the control point to.

[string] effect
  The name of the effect to create. It must be precached.

[number] partAttachment
  See PATTACH_ Enums.

[number] entAttachment=0
  The attachment ID on the entity to attach the particle system to

[Vector] offset=Vector(0,0,0)
  The offset from the Entity:GetPos of the entity we are attaching this CP to.

CreateSound.description:
[Shared] Returns a sound parented to the specified entity.

[Entity] targetEnt
  The target entity.

[string] soundName
  The sound to play.

[CRecipientFilterCPASAttenuationFilter] filter=
  A CRecipientFilter of the players that will have this sound networked to them.

CreateSprite.description:
[Client] 

[IMaterial] material
  Material the sprite should draw.

DebugInfo.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[number] slot
  The location on the right hand screen to write the debug info to. Starts at 0, no upper limit

[string] info
  The debugging information to be written to the screen

DeriveGamemode.description:
[Shared] Retrieves data from a gamemode to use in yours. This also sets a BaseClass field on your GM table to the gamemode you are deriving from. It appears that this function works by running the init and cl_init Lua files of the target gamemode, then overriding functions that appear in both the target and your gamemode with your gamemode's functions.

[string] base
  Gamemode name to derive from.

DermaMenu.description:
[Client/Menu] Creates a DMenu similar to a contextmenu and closes any current menus

[Panel] parent
  The panel to parent the created menu to.

Derma_Anim.description:
[Client/Menu] Creates a new derma animation.

[string] name
  Name of the animation to create

[Panel] panel
  Panel to run the animation on

[function] func
  Function to call to process the animation
Arguments:

 Panel pnl - the panel passed to Derma_Anim
 table anim - the anim table
 number delta - the fraction of the progress through the animation
 any data - optional data passed to the run metatable method

Derma_DrawBackgroundBlur.description:
[Client/Menu] Draws background blur around the given panel.

[Panel] panel
  Panel to draw the background blur around

[number] startTime
  Time that the blur began being painted

Derma_Hook.description:
[Client/Menu] Creates panel method that calls the supplied Derma skin hook via derma.SkinHook

[Panel] panel
  Panel to add the hook to

[string] functionName
  Name of panel function to create

[string] hookName
  Name of Derma skin hook to call within the function

[string] typeName
  Type of element to call Derma skin hook for

Derma_Install_Convar_Functions.description:
[Client/Menu] Makes the panel (usually an input of sorts) respond to changes in console variables by adding next functions to the panel:

[Panel] target
  The panel the functions should be added to.

Derma_Message.description:
[Client/Menu] Creates a derma window to display information

[string] Text
  The text within the created panel.

[string] Title
  The title of the created panel.

[string] Button
  The text of the button to close the panel.

Derma_Query.description:
[Client/Menu] Shows a message box in the middle of the screen, with up to 4 buttons they can press.

[string] text="MessageText(SecondParameter)"
  The message to display.

[string] title="MessageTitle(FirstParameter)"
  The title to give the message box.

[string] btn1text
  The text to display on the first button.

[function] btn1func=nil
  The function to run if the user clicks the first button.

[string] btn2text=nil
  The text to display on the second button.

[function] btn2func=nil
  The function to run if the user clicks the second button.

[string] btn3text=nil
  The text to display on the third button

[function] btn3func=nil
  The function to run if the user clicks the third button.

[string] btn4text=nil
  The text to display on the third button

[function] btn4func=nil
  The function to run if the user clicks the fourth button.

Derma_StringRequest.description:
[Client/Menu] Creates a derma window asking players to input a string.

[string] title
  The title of the created panel.

[string] subtitle
  The text above the input box

[string] default
  The default text for the input box.

[function] confirm
  The function to be called once the user has confirmed their input.

[function] cancel=nil
  The function to be called once the user has cancelled their input

[string] confirmText="OK"
  Allows you to override text of the "OK" button

[string] cancelText="Cancel"
  Allows you to override text of the "Cancel" button

DisableClipping.description:
[Client/Menu] Sets whether rendering should be limited to being inside a panel or not. See also surface.DisableClipping and Panel:NoClipping.

[boolean] disable
  Whether or not clipping should be disabled

DrawBloom.description:
[Client] Draws the bloom shader, which creates a glowing effect from bright objects.

[number] Darken
  Determines how much to darken the effect. A lower number will make the glow come from lower light levels. A value of 1 will make the bloom effect unnoticeable. Negative values will make even pitch black areas glow.

[number] Multiply
  Will affect how bright the glowing spots are. A value of 0 will make the bloom effect unnoticeable.

[number] SizeX
  The size of the bloom effect along the horizontal axis.

[number] SizeY
  The size of the bloom effect along the vertical axis.

[number] Passes
  Determines how much to exaggerate the effect.

[number] ColorMultiply
  Will multiply the colors of the glowing spots, making them more vivid.

[number] Red
  How much red to multiply with the glowing color. Should be between 0 and 1

[number] Green
  How much green to multiply with the glowing color. Should be between 0 and 1

[number] Blue
  How much blue to multiply with the glowing color. Should be between 0 and 1

DrawColorModify.description:
[Client] Draws the Color Modify shader, which can be used to adjust colors on screen.

[table] modifyParameters
  Color modification parameters. See g_colourmodify shader and the example below. Note that if you leave out a field, it will retain its last value which may have changed if another caller uses this function.

DrawMaterialOverlay.description:
[Client] Draws a material overlay on the screen.

[string] Material
  This will be the material that is drawn onto the screen.

[number] RefractAmount
  This will adjust how much the material will refract your screen.

DrawMotionBlur.description:
[Client] Creates a motion blur effect by drawing your screen multiple times.

[number] AddAlpha
  How much alpha to change per frame.

[number] DrawAlpha
  How much alpha the frames will have. A value of 0 will not render the motion blur effect.

[number] Delay
  Determines the amount of time between frames to capture.

DrawSharpen.description:
[Client] Draws the sharpen shader, which creates more contrast.

[number] Contrast
  How much contrast to create.

[number] Distance
  How large the contrast effect will be.

DrawSobel.description:
[Client] Draws the sobel shader, which detects edges and draws a black border.

[number] Threshold
  Determines the threshold of edges. A value of 0 will make your screen completely black.

DrawSunbeams.description:
[Client] Renders the post-processing effect of beams of light originating from the map's sun. Utilises the "pp/sunbeams" material

[number] darken
  $darken property for sunbeams material

[number] multiplier
  $multiply property for sunbeams material

[number] sunSize
  $sunsize property for sunbeams material

[number] sunX
  $sunx property for sunbeams material

[number] sunY
  $suny property for sunbeams material

DrawTexturize.description:
[Client] Draws the texturize shader, which replaces each pixel on your screen with a different part of the texture depending on its brightness. See g_texturize for information on making the texture.

[number] Scale
  Scale of the texture. A smaller number creates a larger texture.

[number] BaseTexture
  This will be the texture to use in the effect. Make sure you use Material to get the texture number

DrawToyTown.description:
[Client] Draws the toy town shader, which blurs the top and bottom of your screen. This can make very large objects look like toys, hence the name.

[number] Passes
  An integer determining how many times to draw the effect. A higher number creates more blur.

[number] Height
  The amount of screen which should be blurred on the top and bottom.

DynamicLight.description:
[Client] Creates or replaces a dynamic light with the given id.

[number] index
  Usually an entity index is used here.

Either.description:
[Shared/Menu] An 'if then else'. This is almost equivalent to (condition and truevar or falsevar) in Lua. The difference is that if truevar evaluates to false, the plain Lua method stated would return falsevar regardless of condition whilst this function would take condition into account.

[any] condition
  The condition to check if true or false.

[any] truevar
  If the condition isn't nil/false, returns this value.

[any] falsevar
  If the condition is nil/false, returns this value.

EmitSentence.description:
[Shared] Plays a sentence from scripts/sentences.txt Seems to work only on serverside.

[string] soundName
  The sound to play

[Vector] position
  The position to play at

[number] entity
  The entity to emit the sound from. Must be Entity:EntIndex

[number] channel=CHAN_AUTO
  The sound channel, see CHAN_ Enums.

[number] volume=1
  The volume of the sound, from 0 to 1

[number] soundLevel=75
  The sound level of the sound, see SNDLVL_ Enums

[number] soundFlags=0
  The flags of the sound, see SND_ Enums

[number] pitch=100
  The pitch of the sound, 0-255

EmitSound.description:
[Shared] Emits the specified sound at the specified position.
Seems to work only clientside.

[string] soundName
  The sound to play

[Vector] position
  The position to play at

[number] entity
  The entity to emit the sound from. Must be Entity:EntIndex

[number] channel=CHAN_AUTO
  The sound channel, see CHAN_ Enums.

[number] volume=1
  The volume of the sound, from 0 to 1

[number] soundLevel=75
  The sound level of the sound, see SNDLVL_ Enums

[number] soundFlags=0
  The flags of the sound, see SND_ Enums

[number] pitch=100
  The pitch of the sound, 0-255

EndTooltip.description:
[Client/Menu] 

[Panel] panel
  This is the panel that has a tool tip.

Error.description:
[Shared/Menu] Throws a Lua error with the specified message and stack level.

[vararg] arguments
  Converts all arguments to strings and prints them with no spacing or line breaks.

ErrorNoHalt.description:
[Shared/Menu] Throws a Lua error but does not break out of the current call stack.

[vararg] arguments
  Converts all arguments to strings and prints them with no spacing.

EyeAngles.description: [Client] Returns the angles of the current render context as calculated by GM:CalcView. This function is only reliable inside rendering hooks.

EyePos.description: [Client] Returns the origin of the current render context as calculated by GM:CalcView. This function is only reliable inside rendering hooks.

EyeVector.description: [Client] Returns the normal vector of the current render context as calculated by GM:CalcView, similar to EyeAngles. This function is only reliable inside rendering hooks.

FindMetaTable.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns the meta table for the class with the matching name. Internally returns debug.getregistry().[metaName] You can find a list of known meta tables that can be retrieved with this function and learn more about meta tables on the Meta Tables page.

[string] metaName
  The object type to retrieve the meta table of.

FindTooltip.description:
[Client/Menu] Returns the tool-tip text and tool-tip-panel (if any) of the given panel as well as itself

[Panel] panel
  Panel to find tool-tip of

Format.description:
[Shared/Menu] Formats the specified values into the string given. Same as string.format.

[string] format
  The string to be formatted.

Follows this format: http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/cstdio/printf/

[vararg] formatParameters
  Values to be formatted into the string.

FrameTime.description: [Shared/Menu] Returns the CurTime-based time in seconds it took to render the last frame. This should be used for frame/tick based timing, such as movement prediction or animations. For real-time-based frame time that isn't affected by host_timescale, use RealFrameTime. RealFrameTime is more suited for things like GUIs or HUDs.

GameDetails.description:
[Menu] Callback function for when the client has joined a server. This function shows the server's loading URL by default.

[string] servername
  Server's name.

[string] serverurl
  Server's loading screen URL, or "" if the URL is not set.

[string] mapname
  Server's current map's name.

[number] maxplayers
  Max player count of server.

[string] steamid
  The local player's Player:SteamID64.

[string] gamemode
  Server's current gamemode's folder name.

GetConVar.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] name
  Name of the ConVar to get

GetConVarNumber.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] name
  Name of the ConVar to get.

GetConVarString.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] name
  Name of the ConVar to get.

GetConVar_Internal.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] name
  Name of the ConVar to get

GetDemoFileDetails.description:
[Menu] 

[string] filename
  The file name of the demo.

GetDownloadables.description: [Menu] Returns a table with the names of files needed from the server you are currently joining.

GetGlobalAngle.description:
[Shared] Returns an angle that is shared between the server and all clients.

[string] index
  The unique index to identify the global value with.

[Angle] default=Angle(0,0,0)
  The value to return if the global value is not set.

GetGlobalBool.description:
[Shared] Returns a boolean that is shared between the server and all clients.

[string] index
  The unique index to identify the global value with.

[boolean] default=false
  The value to return if the global value is not set.

GetGlobalEntity.description:
[Shared] Returns an entity that is shared between the server and all clients.

[string] index
  The unique index to identify the global value with.

[Entity] default=NULL
  The value to return if the global value is not set.

GetGlobalFloat.description:
[Shared] Returns a float that is shared between the server and all clients.

[string] index
  The unique index to identify the global value with.

[number] default=0
  The value to return if the global value is not set.

GetGlobalInt.description:
[Shared] Returns an integer that is shared between the server and all clients.

[string] index
  The unique index to identify the global value with.

[number] default=0
  The value to return if the global value is not set.

GetGlobalString.description:
[Shared] Returns a string that is shared between the server and all clients.

[string] index
  The unique index to identify the global value with.

[string] default=""
  The value to return if the global value is not set.

GetGlobalVector.description:
[Shared] Returns a vector that is shared between the server and all clients.

[string] Index
  The unique index to identify the global value with.

[Vector] Default
  The value to return if the global value is not set.

GetRenderTarget.description:
[Client] Creates or gets the rendertarget with the given name. See GetRenderTargetEx for an advanced version of this function with more options.

[string] name
  The internal name of the render target.

[number] width
  The width of the render target, must be power of 2. If not set to PO2, the size will be automatically converted to the nearest PO2 size.

[number] height
  The height of the render target, must be power of 2. If not set to PO2, the size will be automatically converted to the nearest PO2 size.

[boolean] additive
  Sets whenever the rt should be additive.

GetRenderTargetEx.description:
[Client] Creates (or gets if it already exsits) the rendertarget with the given name, this function allows to adjust the creation of a rendertarget more than GetRenderTarget. See also render.PushRenderTarget and render.SetRenderTarget.

[string] name
  The internal name of the render target.

[number] width
  The width of the render target, must be power of 2.

[number] height
  The height of the render target, must be power of 2.

[number] sizeMode
  Bitflag that influences the sizing of the render target, see RT_SIZE_ Enums.

[number] depthMode
  Bitflag that determines the depth buffer usage of the render target MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH_ Enums.

[number] textureFlags
  Bitflag that configurates the texture, see TEXTUREFLAGS_ Enums.
List of flags can also be found on the Valve's Developer Wiki:

https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Valve_Texture_Format

[number] rtFlags
  Flags that controll the HDR behaviour of the render target, see CREATERENDERTARGETFLAGS_ Enums.

[number] imageFormat
  Image format, see IMAGE_FORMAT_ Enums.

GetSaveFileDetails.description:
[Menu] 

[string] filename
  The file name of the save.

HSVToColor.description:
[Shared/Menu] Converts a color from HSV color space into RGB color space and returns a Color structure.

[number] hue
  Hue in degrees.

[number] saturation
  Saturation from 0 - 1.

[number] value
  Value from 0 - 1.

HTTP.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[table] parameters
  The request parameters. See HTTPRequest structure.

IncludeCS.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] filename
  The filename of the Lua file you want to include.

IsColor.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[any] Object
  The object to be tested

IsEnemyEntityName.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] className
  Class name of the entity to check

IsFirstTimePredicted.description: [Shared] Returns if this is the first time this hook was predicted. This is useful for one-time logic in your SWEPs PrimaryAttack, SecondaryAttack and Reload and other predicted hooks (to prevent those hooks from being called rapidly in succession). It's also useful in a Move hook for when the client predicts movement. Visit Prediction for more information about this behavior.

IsFriendEntityName.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] className
  Class name of the entity to check

IsMounted.description:
[Shared/Menu] Checks whether or not a game is currently mounted. Uses data given by engine.GetGames. Currently does not work correctly serverside on dedicated servers.

[string] game
  The game string/app ID to check.

IsTableOfEntitiesValid.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[table] table
  Table containing entities to check

IsUselessModel.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] modelName
  The model name to be checked

IsValid.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[any] toBeValidated
  The table or object to be validated.

JS_Language.description:
[Client/Menu] 

[Panel] htmlPanel
  Panel to add javascript function 'language.Update' to.

JS_Utility.description:
[Client/Menu] 

[Panel] htmlPanel
  Panel to add javascript function 'util.MotionSensorAvailable' to.

JS_Workshop.description:
[Client/Menu] 

[Panel] htmlPanel
  Panel to add javascript functions to.

JoinServer.description:
[Menu] Joins the server with the specified IP.

[string] IP
  The IP of the server to join

Label.description:
[Client/Menu] Convenience function that creates a DLabel, sets the text, and returns it

[string] text
  The string to set the label's text to

[Panel] parent=nil
  Optional. The panel to parent the DLabel to

LanguageChanged.description:
[Menu] Callback function for when the client's language changes. Called by the engine.

[string] lang
  The new language code.

Lerp.description:
[Shared/Menu] Performs a linear interpolation from the start number to the end number. This function provides a very efficient and easy way to smooth out movements.

[number] t
  The fraction for finding the result. This number is clamped between 0 and 1.

[number] from
  The starting number. The result will be equal to this if delta is 0.

[number] to
  The ending number. The result will be equal to this if delta is 1.

LerpAngle.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns point between first and second angle using given fraction and linear interpolation

[number] ratio
  Ratio of progress through values

[Angle] angleStart
  Angle to begin from

[Angle] angleEnd
  Angle to end at

LerpVector.description:
[Shared/Menu] Linear interpolation between two vectors. It is commonly used to smooth movement between two vectors.

[number] fraction
  Fraction ranging from 0 to 1

[Vector] from
  The initial Vector

[Vector] to
  The desired Vector

LoadPresets.description: [Client] Loads all preset settings for the presets library and returns them in a table

LocalPlayer.description: [Client] Returns the player object of the current client. LocalPlayer() will return NULL until all entities have been initialized. See GM:InitPostEntity.

LocalToWorld.description:
[Shared] Translates the specified position and angle from the specified local coordinate system into worldspace coordinates. If you're working with an entity's local vectors, use Entity:LocalToWorld and/or Entity:LocalToWorldAngles instead. See also: WorldToLocal, the reverse of this function.

[Vector] localPos
  The position vector in the source coordinate system, that should be translated to world coordinates

[Angle] localAng
  The angle in the source coordinate system, that should be converted to a world angle. If you don't need to convert an angle, you can supply an arbitrary valid angle (e.g. Angle()).

[Vector] originPos
  The origin point of the source coordinate system, in world coordinates

[Angle] originAngle
  The angles of the source coordinate system, as a world angle

Localize.description:
[Client/Menu] 

[string] localisationToken
  The token to find a translation for.

[string] default
  The default value to be returned if no translation was found.

Material.description:
[Shared/Menu] Either returns the material with the given name, or loads the material interpreting the first argument as the path.

[string] materialName
  The material name or path. The path is relative to the materials/ folder. You do not need to add materials/ to your path.

To retrieve a Lua material created with CreateMaterial, just prepend a "!" to the material name.

[string] pngParameters=nil
  A string containing space separated keywords which will be used to add material parameters.
See Material Parameters for more information.

Mesh.description:
[Client] Returns a new mesh object.

[IMaterial] mat=nil
  The material the mesh is intended to be rendered with. It's merely a hint that tells that mesh what vertex format it should use.

Model.description:
[Shared/Menu] Runs util.PrecacheModel and returns the string

[string] model
  The model to precache

Msg.description:
[Shared/Menu] Writes every given argument to the console.
Automatically attempts to convert each argument to a string. (See tostring)
Unlike print, arguments are not separated by anything. They are simply concatenated. The text is blue on the server and orange on the client:

[vararg] args
  List of values to print.

MsgAll.description:
[Shared] 

[vararg] args
  List of values to print.

MsgC.description:
[Shared/Menu] Just like Msg, except it can also print colored text, just like chat.AddText.

[vararg] args
  Values to print. If you put in a color, all text after that color will be printed in that color.

MsgN.description:
[Shared/Menu] Same as print, except it concatinates the arguments without inserting any whitespace in between them. See also Msg, which doesn't add a newline ("\n") at the end.

[vararg] args
  List of values to print. They can be of any type and will be converted to strings with tostring.

NumModelSkins.description:
[Client] 

[string] modelName
  Model to return amount of skins of

OnModelLoaded.description:
[Client] 

[string] modelName
  Name of the model.

[number] numPostParams
  Number of pose parameters the model has.

[number] numSeq
  Number of sequences the model has.

[number] numAttachments
  Number of attachments the model has.

[number] numBoneControllers
  Number of bone controllers the model has.

[number] numSkins
  Number of skins that the model has.

[number] size
  Size of the model.

OpenFolder.description:
[Menu] Opens a folder with the given name in the garrysmod folder using the operating system's file browser. Currently broken on OS X and Linux.

[string] folder
  The subdirectory to open in the garrysmod folder.

OrderVectors.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[Vector] vector1
  Bounding box min resultant

[Vector] vector2
  Bounding box max resultant

ParticleEffect.description:
[Shared] Creates a particle effect.

[string] particleName
  The name of the particle effect.

[Vector] position
  The start position of the effect.

[Angle] angles
  The orientation of the effect.

[Entity] parent=NULL
  If set, the particle will be parented to the entity.

ParticleEffectAttach.description:
[Shared] Creates a particle effect with specialized parameters.

[string] particleName
  The name of the particle effect.

[number] attachType
  Attachment type using PATTACH_ Enums.

[Entity] entity
  The entity to be used in the way specified by the attachType.

[number] attachmentID
  The id of the attachment to be used in the way specified by the attachType.

ParticleEmitter.description:
[Client] Creates a new CLuaEmitter.

[Vector] position
  The start position of the emitter.

This is only used to determine particle drawing order for translucent particles.

[boolean] use3D
  Whenever to render the particles in 2D or 3D mode.

Path.description:
[Server] 

[string] type
  The name of the path to create.

This is going to be "Follow" or "Chase" right now.

PositionSpawnIcon.description:
[Client] Moves the given model to the given position and returns view information based on its properties

[Entity] model
  Model that is being rendered to the spawn icon

[Vector] position
  Position that the model is being rendered at

PrecacheParticleSystem.description:
[Shared] 

[string] particleSystemName
  The name of the particle system.

PrecacheScene.description:
[Server] 

[string] scene
  Path to the scene file to precache.

PrecacheSentenceFile.description:
[Server] Load and precache a custom sentence file.

[string] filename
  The path to the custom sentences.txt.

PrecacheSentenceGroup.description:
[Server] Precache a sentence group in a sentences.txt definition file.

[string] group
  The group to precache.

PrintMessage.description:
[Server] Displays a message in the chat, console, or center of screen of every player. This uses the archaic user message system (umsg library) and hence is limited to 250 characters.

[number] type
  Which type of message should be sent to the players (see HUD_ Enums)

[string] message
  Message to be sent to the players

PrintTable.description:
[Shared/Menu] Recursively prints the contents of a table to the console.

[table] tableToPrint
  The table to be printed

[number] indent=0
  Number of tabs to start indenting at. Increases by 2 when entering another table.

[table] done={}
  Internal argument, you shouldn't normally change this. Used to check if a nested table has already been printed so it doesn't get caught in a loop.

RandomPairs.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns an iterator function that can be used to loop through a table in random order

[table] table
  Table to create iterator for

[boolean] descending
  Whether the iterator should iterate descending or not

RegisterDermaMenuForClose.description:
[Client/Menu] 

[Panel] menu
  Menu to be registered for closure

RenderDoF.description:
[Client] Renders a Depth of Field effect

[Vector] origin
  Origin to render the effect at

[Angle] angle
  Angle to render the effect at

[Vector] usableFocusPoint
  Point to focus the effect at

[number] angleSize
  Angle size of the effect

[number] radialSteps
  Amount of radial steps to render the effect with

[number] passes
  Amount of render passes

[boolean] spin
  Whether to cycle the frame or not

[table] inView
  Table of view data

[number] fov
  FOV to render the effect with

RenderStereoscopy.description:
[Client] 

[Vector] viewOrigin
  Origin to render the effect at

[Angle] viewAngles
  Angles to render the effect at

RenderSuperDoF.description:
[Client] Renders the Super Depth of Field post-process effect

[Vector] viewOrigin
  Origin to render the effect at

[Angle] viewAngles
  Angles to render the effect at

[number] viewFOV
  Field of View to render the effect at

RunConsoleCommand.description:
[Shared/Menu] Executes the given console command with the parameters.

[string] command
  The command to be executed.

[vararg] arguments
  The arguments. Note, that unlike Player:ConCommand, you must pass each argument as a new string, not separating them with a space.

RunGameUICommand.description:
[Menu] Runs a menu command. Equivalent to RunConsoleCommand( "gamemenucommand", command ) unless the command starts with the "engine" keyword in which case it is equivalent to RunConsoleCommand( command ).

[string] command
  The menu command to run
Should be one of the following:

 Disconnect - Disconnects from the current server.
 OpenBenchmarkDialog - Opens the "Video Hardware Stress Test" dialog.
 OpenChangeGameDialog - Does not work in GMod.
 OpenCreateMultiplayerGameDialog - Opens the Source dialog for creating a listen server.
 OpenCustomMapsDialog - Does nothing.
 OpenFriendsDialog - Does nothing.
 OpenGameMenu - Does not work in GMod.
 OpenLoadCommentaryDialog - Opens the "Developer Commentary" selection dialog. Useless in GMod.
 OpenLoadDemoDialog - Does nothing.
 OpenLoadGameDialog - Opens the Source "Load Game" dialog.
 OpenNewGameDialog - Opens the "New Game" dialog. Useless in GMod.
 OpenOptionsDialog - Opens the options dialog.
 OpenPlayerListDialog - Opens the "Mute Players" dialog that shows all players connected to the server and allows to mute them.
 OpenSaveGameDialog - Opens the Source "Save Game" dialog.
 OpenServerBrowser - Opens the legacy server browser.
 Quit - Quits the game without confirmation (unlike other Source games).
 QuitNoConfirm - Quits the game without confirmation (like other Source games).
 ResumeGame - Closes the menu and returns to the game.
 engine <concommand> - Runs a console command. Equivalent to RunConsoleCommand( <concommand> ).

RunString.description:
[Shared/Menu] Evaluates and executes the given code, will throw an error on failure. Note that local variables are not passed to the given code.

[string] code
  The code to execute.

[string] identifier="RunString"
  The name that should appear in any error messages caused by this code.

[boolean] handleError=true
  If false, this function will return a string containing any error messages instead of throwing an error.

SQLStr.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns the input value in an escaped form so that it can safely be used inside of queries. The returned value is surrounded by quotes unless noQuotes is true. Alias of sql.SQLStr

[string] input
  String to be escaped

[boolean] noQuotes=false
  Whether the returned value should be surrounded in quotes or not

SScale.description:
[Client] 

[number] Size
  The number you want to scale.

STNDRD.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns the ordinal suffix of a given number.

[number] number
  The number to find the ordinal suffix of.

SafeRemoveEntityDelayed.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[Entity] entity
  Entity to be removed

[number] delay
  Delay for entity removal in seconds

SaveLastMap.description:
[Menu] 

[string] map
  The name of the map.

[string] category
  The name of the category to which this map belongs.

ScrH.description: [Client/Menu] Returns the height of GMod's window (in pixels).

ScrW.description: [Client/Menu] Gets the width of GMod window (in pixels).

ScreenScale.description:
[Client] Returns a number based on the Size argument and your screen's width. The screen's width is always equal to size 640. This function is primarily used for scaling font sizes.

[number] Size
  The number you want to scale.

SendUserMessage.description:
[Shared] Send a usermessage

[string] name
  The name of the usermessage

[any] recipients
  Can be a CRecipientFilter, table or Player object.

[vararg] args
  Data to send in the usermessage

ServerLog.description:
[Server] 

[string] parameter
  The value to be printed to console.

SetClipboardText.description:
[Client/Menu] Adds the given string to the computers clipboard, which can then be pasted in or outside of GMod with Ctrl + V.

[string] text
  The text to add to the clipboard.

SetGlobalAngle.description:
[Shared] 

[any] index
  Index to identify the global angle with

[Angle] angle
  Angle to be networked

SetGlobalBool.description:
[Shared] 

[any] index
  Index to identify the global boolean with

[boolean] bool
  Boolean to be networked

SetGlobalEntity.description:
[Shared] 

[any] index
  Index to identify the global entity with

[Entity] ent
  Entity to be networked

SetGlobalFloat.description:
[Shared] 

[any] index
  Index to identify the global float with

[number] float
  Float to be networked

SetGlobalInt.description:
[Shared] Sets an integer that is shared between the server and all clients.

[string] Index
  The unique index to identify the global value with.

[number] Value
  The value to set the global value to. This will be cast intoto a 128-bit int internally

SetGlobalString.description:
[Shared] 

[any] index
  Index to identify the global string with

[string] string
  String to be networked

SetGlobalVector.description:
[Shared] 

[any] index
  Index to identify the global vector with

[Vector] vec
  Vector to be networked

SortedPairs.description:
[Shared/Menu] This function can be used in a for loop instead of pairs. It sorts all keys alphabetically. For sorting by specific value member, use SortedPairsByMemberValue.
For sorting by value, use SortedPairsByValue.

[table] table
  The table to sort

[boolean] desc=false
  Reverse the sorting order

SortedPairsByMemberValue.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns an iterator function that can be used to loop through a table in order of member values, when the values of the table are also tables and contain that member. To sort by value, use SortedPairsByValue.
To sort by keys, use SortedPairs.

[table] table
  Table to create iterator for.

[any] memberKey
  Key of the value member to sort by.

[boolean] descending=false
  Whether the iterator should iterate in descending order or not.

SortedPairsByValue.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns an iterator function that can be used to loop through a table in order of its values. To sort by specific value member, use SortedPairsByMemberValue.
To sort by keys, use SortedPairs.

[table] table
  Table to create iterator for

[boolean] descending=false
  Whether the iterator should iterate in descending order or not

Sound.description:
[Shared/Menu] Runs util.PrecacheSound and returns the string

[string] soundPath
  The soundpath to precache

SuppressHostEvents.description:
[Server] 

[Player] suppressPlayer
  The player to suppress any networking to.

SysTime.description: [Shared/Menu] Returns a highly accurate time in seconds since the start up, ideal for benchmarking.

TimedCos.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns a cosine value that fluctuates based on the current time

[number] frequency
  The frequency of fluctuation

[number] min
  Minimum value

[number] max
  Maxmimum value

[number] offset
  Offset variable that doesn't affect the rate of change, but causes the returned value to be offset by time

TimedSin.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns a sine value that fluctuates based on CurTime. The value returned will be between the start value plus/minus the range value. Due to a bug, the range arguments don't work as intended. The existing (bugged) behavior is documented below.

[number] frequency
  The frequency of fluctuation, in hertz

[number] origin
  The center value of the sine wave.

[number] max
  This argument's distance from origin defines the size of the full range of the sine wave. For example, if origin is 3 and max is 5, then the full range of the sine wave is 5-3 = 2. 3 is the center point of the sine wave, so the sine wave will range between 2 and 4.

[number] offset
  Offset variable that doesn't affect the rate of change, but causes the returned value to be offset by time

TypeID.description:
[Shared] 

[any] variable
  The variable to get the type ID of.

UTIL_IsUselessModel.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] modelName
  The model name to be checked

UpdateLoadPanel.description:
[Menu] 

[string] javascript
  JavaScript to run on the loading panel.

VGUIRect.description:
[Client] Creates and returns a DShape rectangle GUI element with the given dimensions.

[number] x
  X position of the created element

[number] y
  Y position of the created element

[number] w
  Width of the created element

[number] h
  Height of the created element

Vector.description:
[Shared/Menu] Creates a Vector object.

[number] x=0
  The x component of the vector.
If this is a Vector, this function will return a copy of the given vector.
If this is a string, this function will try to parse the string as a vector. If it fails, it returns a 0 vector.

(See examples)

[number] y=0
  The y component of the vector.

[number] z=0
  The z component of the vector.

VisualizeLayout.description:
[Client/Menu] 

[Panel] panel
  Panel to display layout details of

WorkshopFileBase.description:
[Client/Menu] 

[string] namespace
  Namespace for the file base

[table] requiredTags
  Tags required for a Workshop submission to be interacted with by the filebase

WorldToLocal.description:
[Shared] Translates the specified position and angle into the specified coordinate system.

[Vector] position
  The position that should be translated from the current to the new system.

[Angle] angle
  The angles that should be translated from the current to the new system.

[Vector] newSystemOrigin
  The origin of the system to translate to.

[Angle] newSystemAngles
  The angles of the system to translate to.

assert.description:
[Shared/Menu] If the result of the first argument is false or nil, an error is thrown with the second argument as the message.

[any] expression
  The expression to assert.

[string] errorMessage="assertionfailed!"
  The error message to throw when assertion fails.

collectgarbage.description:
[Shared/Menu] Executes the specified action on the garbage collector.

[string] action="collect"
  The action to run.

Valid actions are "collect", "stop", "restart", "count", "step", "setpause" and "setstepmul".

[number] arg
  The argument of the specified action, only applicable for "step", "setpause" and "setstepmul".

error.description:
[Shared/Menu] Throws a Lua error and breaks out of the current call stack.

[string] message
  The error message to throw.

[number] errorLevel=1
  The level to throw the error at.

getfenv.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[function] location=1
  The object to get the enviroment from. Can also be a number that specifies the function at that stack level: Level 1 is the function calling getfenv.

getmetatable.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns the metatable of an object. This function obeys the metatable's __metatable field, and will return that field if the metatable has it set. Use debug.getmetatable if you want the true metatable of the object.

[any] object
  The value to return the metatable of.

include.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] fileName
  The name of the script to be executed.

ipairs.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns an iterator function for a for loop, to return ordered key-value pairs from a table. This will only iterate though numerical keys, and these must also be sequential; starting at 1 with no gaps. For unordered pairs, see pairs.
For pairs sorted by key in alphabetical order, see SortedPairs.

[table] tab
  The table to iterate over.

isangle.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[any] variable
  The variable to perform the type check for.

isbool.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[any] variable
  The variable to perform the type check for.

isentity.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[any] variable
  The variable to perform the type check for.

isfunction.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[any] variable
  The variable to perform the type check for.

ismatrix.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[any] variable
  The variable to perform the type check for.

isnumber.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[any] variable
  The variable to perform the type check for.

ispanel.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[any] variable
  The variable to perform the type check for.

isstring.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[any] variable
  The variable to perform the type check for.

istable.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[any] variable
  The variable to perform the type check for.

isvector.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[any] variable
  The variable to perform the type check for.

module.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] name
  The name of the module. This will be used to access the module table in the runtime environment.

[vararg] loaders
  Calls each function passed with the new table as an argument.

newproxy.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[boolean] addMetatable=false
  If true, the userdata will get its own metatable automatically.

next.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns the next key and value pair in a table.

[table] tab
  The table

[any] prevKey=nil
  The previous key in the table.

pairs.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns an iterator function(next) for a for loop that will return the values of the specified table in an arbitrary order. For alphabetical key order use SortedPairs.
For alphabetical value order use SortedPairsByValue.

[table] tab
  The table to iterate over

pcall.description:
[Shared/Menu] Calls a function and catches an error that can be thrown while the execution of the call.

[function] func
  Function to be executed and of which the errors should be caught of

[vararg] arguments
  Arguments to call the function with.

print.description:
[Shared/Menu] Writes every given argument to the console.
Automatically attempts to convert each argument to a string. (See tostring)
Separates arguments with a tab character ("\t").

[vararg] args
  List of values to print.

rawequal.description:
[Shared/Menu] Compares the two values without calling their __eq operator.

[any] value1
  The first value to compare.

[any] value2
  The second value to compare.

rawget.description:
[Shared/Menu] Gets the value with the specified key from the table without calling the __index method.

[table] table
  Table to get the value from.

[any] index
  The index to get the value from.

rawset.description:
[Shared/Menu] Sets the value with the specified key from the table without calling the __newindex method.

[table] table
  Table to get the value from.

[any] index
  The index to get the value from.

[any] value
  The value to set for the specified key.

require.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[string] name
  The name of the module to be loaded.

select.description:
[Shared/Menu] Used to select single values from a vararg or get the count of values in it.

[any] parameter
  Can be a number or string.

 If it's a string and starts with "#", the function will return the amount of values in the vararg (ignoring the rest of the string).
 If it's a positive number, the function will return all values starting from the given index.
 If the number is negative, it will return the amount specified from the end instead of the beginning.

[vararg] vararg
  The vararg. These are the values from which you want to select.

setfenv.description:
[Shared/Menu] 

[function] location
  The function to set the enviroment for or a number representing stack level.

[table] enviroment
  Table to be used as enviroment.

setmetatable.description:
[Shared/Menu] Sets, changes or removes a table's metatable. Returns Tab (the first argument).

[table] Tab
  The table who's metatable to change.

[table] Metatable
  The metatable to assign.If it's nil, the metatable will be removed.

tobool.description:
[Shared/Menu] Attempts to return an appropriate boolean for the given value

[any] val
  The object to be converted to a boolean

tonumber.description:
[Shared/Menu] Attempts to convert the value to a number. Returns nil on failure.

[any] value
  The value to convert. Can be a number or string.

[number] base=10
  The numeric base used in the string. Can be any integer between 2 and 36, inclusive.

tostring.description:
[Shared/Menu] Attempts to convert the value to a string. If the value is an object and its metatable has defined the __tostring metamethod, this will call that function. print also uses this functionality.

[any] value
  The object to be converted to a string.

type.description:
[Shared/Menu] Returns a string representing the name of the type of the passed object.

[any] var
  The object to get the type of.

unpack.description:
[Shared/Menu] This function takes a numeric indexed table and return all the members as a vararg. If specified, it will start at the given index and end at end index.

[table] tbl
  The table to generate the vararg from.

[number] startIndex=1
  Which index to start from. Optional.

[number] endIndex=#tbl
  Which index to end at. Optional, even if you set StartIndex.

xpcall.description:
[Shared/Menu] Attempts to call the first function. If the execution succeeds, this returns true followed by the returns of the function. If execution fails, this returns false and the second function is called with the error message. Unlike in pcall, the stack is not unwound and can therefore be used for stack analyses with the debug library.

[function] func
  The function to call initially.

[function] errorCallback
  The function to be called if execution of the first fails; the error message is passed as a string.

You cannot throw an error() from this callback: it will have no effect (not even stopping the callback).

[vararg] arguments
  Arguments to pass to the initial function.
